par.text: Hydrogen is the most plentiful element in the universe. It is the major component of star matter. It is estimated that in the universe hydrogen atoms outnumber the atoms of all other elements together by a ratio of 6:1. Hydrogen is also abundant in the Earth's crust. It is found mostly in the combined state. The chief hydrogen compound is water

Hydrogen, together with carbon, is the principal building material of living matter. Traces of free hydrogen - 0.00005% by volume – are present in the upper part of the atmosphere. Hydrogen makes up 0.152% of the Earth's crust by weight. In abundance hydrogen ranks 10th among the elements.
